newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria seeks 75,000 tonnes of soft wheat.
newsitem.headline: Algeria seeks 75,000 tonnes of soft wheat.

text.p: Algeria is seeking an extra 75,000 tonnes of soft wheat of French and/or Argentine origin in three lots of 25,000 tonnes each, trading sources said.
The loading of the shipments is set for November and December.
The tender was launched on Monday and expires on Thursday. Traders expect a result by the end of the week.
Last week, Algeria bought 150,000 tonnes of soft wheat of which 100,000 tonnes was of French origin and 50,000 tonnes came from Argentina.
It paid $169.00 cash per tonne for the Argentine wheat including cost and freight and $186-$188 for the French wheat with a credit from Coface.
